greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = numerator of (Pi^2)/2 - Zeta(2,(2*n-1)/2), where Zeta is the Hurwitz Zeta function.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..300
formula: a(n) = numerator of (Zeta(2, 1/2) - Zeta(2, n-1/2)), where Zeta is the Hurwitz Zeta function. - _Peter Luschny_, Nov 14 2017
a(n) = numerator of Sum_{k=0..(n-2)} 4/(2*k+1)^2. - _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 23 2018
program: (MAGMA) [0] cat [Numerator((&+[4/(2*k+1)^2: k in [0..n-2]])): n in [2..20]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 23 2018
results.author: _Artur Jasinski_, Mar 03 2010
